mental_model.explanation: React 19 is like a major OS upgrade. It brings big new apps (Server Components), but also lots of 'quality of life' improvements. You don't need `forwardRef` anymore (like not needing a dongle for headphones), and you can manage window titles directly (like changing desktop wallpaper easily).

real_world_use_cases: Setting the document title dynamically from any component.
Passing refs to functional components without wrappers.

related_concepts.relationship: Deprecated (mostly) in React 19 as refs can be passed as props.
React 19 provides native support for metadata, replacing the need for external libraries like Helmet.

concepts.name: Ref as a Prop
concepts.description: You can now pass `ref` as a prop to function components.
details: The `ref` is accessible directly in the props object.
Simplifies higher-order components and component wrappers.

code_example.explanation: Note how `ref` is just another prop in the arguments list.

concepts.name: Document Metadata
concepts.description: Native support for rendering `<title>`, `<meta>`, and `<link>` tags anywhere in the component tree.
details: React automatically hoists these tags to the `<head>`.
Works in both Client and Server Components.
Ensures duplicate tags (like multiple titles) are handled correctly (last one wins).

code_example.explanation: The `<title>` tag will be moved to the document `<head>` automatically.

concepts.name: Cleanup Functions for Refs
concepts.description: Ref callbacks can now return a cleanup function.
details: Similar to `useEffect`, the cleanup runs when the element is removed.
Useful for cleaning up observers or subscriptions attached to a DOM node.

code_example.snippet:
<div ref={node => {
  const observer = new ResizeObserver(...);
  observer.observe(node);
  return () => observer.disconnect(); // Cleanup
}} />
code_example.explanation: React calls the returned function when the `div` unmounts.
